semantic_identifier: 45: feat: Add standardized customerEvidence schema to signal ingestion + safe backfill for existing records

sections.text:
## Description

This PR standardizes how we capture and persist customer language/supporting evidence across all ingested signal types (CRM notes, surveys, support tickets, interviews, usage annotations).

Changes:
- Introduces a shared `customerEvidence` object on ingested signal records:
  - `sourceType` (enum of supported sources)
  - `capturedAt` (timestamp of the evidence; defaults to signal timestamp)
  - `verbatim` (quote/snippet; plaintext)
  - `artifactRef` (opaque reference/link back to the original system artifact; e.g., URL, external id + system)
- Updates all ingestion adapters to populate `customerEvidence` consistently (mapping source-specific fields into the shared schema).
- Adds DB migration to add the new column/fields (backwards-compatible; nullable).
- Implements a low-risk backfill for existing records:
  - Sets `sourceType` based on existing signal metadata
  - Uses existing `createdAt/occurredAt` for `capturedAt` when available
  - Copies any existing snippet/text field into `verbatim` where present
  - Best-effort `artifactRef` from stored external IDs/URLs; otherwise leaves null
- Updates positioning generation/read-path logic to tolerate missing evidence fields and to prefer `customerEvidence.verbatim` when present, preventing downstream breakage.

Notes for reviewers:
- No behavioral changes intended beyond consistent storage; output should remain stable except that newly ingested/updated records will carry richer, uniform evidence metadata.
- Backfill is intentionally conservative to avoid incorrect links/quotes; missing fields remain null rather than guessing.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
